I was lucky enough to crawl under a Castor 120 @ SPFA, while it was on the pad. It had a skirt covering the nozzle, so I couldn't just "light a match." I knew the RSO for that particular program. I heard a story about a time when a particular individual was VERY close to an STS launch and  they expressed there was nothing like it in the world. The sound wave is ridiculous. I remember getting briefed on a certain spell. If I smelled something like this then I should basically head over in this direction and hunker down. I can't remember what the smell was, but I think it had to do with the Hydrazine used for hypergolic fuel. This is just one of the cool things I experienced on the Cape that day. I want to say more, but I digress.

Hey Destin, i'd like to talk about the NordVPN thing, being that i earn money with networks. I am not an IT-security expert, but i do know how VPNs work and what they can and can not do.

Sadly there are some things you said that are...a bit incorrect. You said that your network traffic "is encrypted and protected all the way to the host you're trying to contact." This is not true. The tunnel that NordVPN makes for you goes all the way to a NordVPN exit node. When you are accessing e.g. your bank account, you are basically letting NordVPN connect to your banks website for you and relaying the data that is being transfered to your computer. So if you send data to your bank, you instead send it via the tunnel to NordVPN and they in turn send it over the regular internet to your bank. This means you're basically giving your sensitive data to NordVPN and trust them to not do anything else with it than getting it to where you want it to end up.

If you want to get deeper into this, feel free to contact me, twitter@Phrewfuf. And if you wish, i might be able to get some ITsec experts in on this.

couple thoughts:
is there any in use space launch vehicles that use asparagus staging(im not counting the shuttle due to the external tank not being a booster)? i understand that the propellant requirements are insane but it would be more efficient for the delta iv to run full throttle until separation as long as the center stage still has a lot of fuel and if the space craft can handle the forces.

-i know of two ways to vector SRB's, first is like they do here and on the space shuttle and vector the nozzle and the other way is using controlled injections into the nozzle to bias the thrust.

the use of SRB's on upper stages is almost always down to cost. SRB's are not as efficient so you need more fuel to get the extra fuel into orbit, and you need more fuel for that more fuel. the cost of making a SRB is pennies compared to making a liquid rocket engine so there are cases like this where it costs less in fuel lifting the in-efficinet engine than it would have to make the liquid engine. if they needed a higher delta v they would have used a liquid engine.

Quick note on the ad 11:57 - the computer isn't encrypted, that's something else. A VPN encrypts all the messages your computer sends, and sends them to another computer somewhere in a network that your trust more than the one you're connected to yourself. This hides unencrypted data from eavesdroppers between you and the VPN computer/endpoint, and makes it seem to the final recipient of your message as if the message was sent from the location of that VPN end point.
